name: Cup Flower
climate: Cup Flowers thrive in temperate climates where temperatures are moderate.
They can adapt well to Mediterranean climates with wet winters and dry summers.
These plants also do well in subtropical climates with mild temperatures year-round.
Regions with seasonal rainfalls often provide the optimal climate for Cup Flowers.
sunlight: Cup Flowers require full sun exposure for optimal growth and blooming.
They can tolerate partial shade, but flowering may be reduced.
Ensure the plants receive at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily.
Dappled sunlight conditions may lead to leggier growth and fewer blooms.
watering: Cup Flowers prefer consistently moist soil but should not be waterlogged.
Regular watering is essential, especially during dry spells or hot periods.
Allow the top inch of the soil to dry between watering sessions.
Drip irrigation or soaker hoses can provide even moisture without wetting foliage.
soil: Cup Flowers thrive in well-draining soil with a loose and porous texture.
They prefer sandy loam to loamy soil with high organic content for nutrients.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral, between 6.0 to 7.0.
Amend clay soils with sand and compost to improve drainage and fertility.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continued flowering throughout the season.
Provide support or staking if plants grow tall and become top-heavy with blooms.
